alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 11:58PM AKDT until March 31 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow occurring with winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Plan on areas of poor visibility resulting in difficult travel conditions at times. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 4 AM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Poor visibility is currently occuring east of Point Lay, and will gradually improve Tuesday afternoon. From Point Lay west, winds will increase Tuesday evening, leading to reduced visibility in blowing snow, which will continue through Wednesday night. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties.
